document_title: Penile cancer: Causes, signs, diagnosis and prevention
subsection_content:
Changes in the skin of the penis are the most common symptom of penile cancer. Signs may appear on the foreskin (uncircumcised men), on the head of the penis or on the shaft of the penis.
Symptoms of penile cancer include:
Change in penile skin thickness or color; Rash or small scaly bumps on the penis; Lumps on the penis; Foul-smelling discharge under the foreskin; Feeling pain, possibly bleeding during erection or during sex; Swelling of the penis; Lumps under the skin in the groin area
However, these symptoms are not always considered a warning of penile cancer. Infectious problems or allergic reactions can also cause the above symptoms. Therefore, it is necessary to see a specialist in Andrology - Urology so that the doctor can review and give appropriate treatment.
